conversation.content: This was supposed to be relaxing, you know? I can't believe we're already lost.
Oh jeez, we're not lost, we're just... temporarily unsure of our exact location. The river only goes one way, so technically we can't be that lost, right?
My arms are killing me. How much further do you think?
Umm, based on when we started, probably another hour? Maybe hour and a half? Though honestly, I wasn't really paying attention to the time when we launched, so that's kind of a guess.
An hour and a half? Are you serious right now?
Look, I mean, kayaking is supposed to be about the journey, not the destination. Plus the scenery is gorgeous—those cliffs, the eagles we saw earlier, that's pretty special stuff.
The eagles were cool, I'll give you that. But my sunscreen washed off ages ago.
Eesh, yeah, that's not good. I've got some waterproof SPF 50 in my dry bag if you want it. Though, um, applying it while paddling might be a bit of a challenge.
Everything hurts. My back, my shoulders, even my fingers somehow.
That's actually pretty normal for first-timers—you're using muscles you don't normally use. Tomorrow's gonna be rough, I'm not gonna lie. Ice and ibuprofen will be your best friends.
Why didn't you tell me it would be this hard?
[very quietly] Because, honestly, if I'd told you everything—the soreness, the sun exposure, the possibility of tipping—you never would've come, and I really wanted someone to go with.
That's manipulative. I trusted you when you said it would be fun.
Okay so, yeah, I may have downplayed the physical demands a little bit, but come on, we're making memories here! Years from now you'll laugh about this.
I'm never doing this again. My phone's dead, we're lost, and I'm starving.
Hmm, well, there's a cooler full of sandwiches waiting at the takeout point, assuming we ever find it. And hey, being disconnected from technology for a few hours isn't the worst thing.
A few hours? You said this would take two hours total!
Uhhh, I said two hours of paddling time, which, admittedly, doesn't include breaks, getting lost, or, um, that twenty minutes we spent untangling from those branches.
I can't believe I let you talk me into this disaster.
[condescending] Oh please, you're being so dramatic about this. It's a little kayak trip, not some survival expedition—millions of people do this for fun every weekend without whining constantly.
